info.description:
This is a beta interactive API explorer for the RingCentral Connect Platform. To use this service, you will need to have an account with the proper credentials to generate an OAuth2 access token.

Quick Start

  1. 1) Go to Authentication > /oauth/token
  2. 2) Enter app_key, app_secret, username, password fields and then click "Try it out!"
  3. 3) Upon success, your access_token is loaded and you can access any form requiring authorization.
Links
  • RingCentral Developer Program and API Docs
  • RingCentral SDKs on Github
  • RingCentral Developer Support Email
info.title: RingCentral Connect Platform API Explorer

post.description:
This endpoint supports two flows:

1) Resource Owner Password Credentials Flow: Issues new access and refresh tokens. Requests to this endpoint must be authenticated with HTTP Basic scheme. The following paramters are required for this flow:

  • 1) api_key
  • 2) api_secret
  • 3) username
  • 4) password

This flow can use all the parameters below except for the refresh_token parameter which is used for the Refresh Token Flow decribed below. Since 1.0.4 (Release 5.13)

2) Refresh Token Flow: Issues new access and refresh tokens by previously issued refresh token. Requests to this endpoint must be authenticated with HTTP Basic scheme. The following parameters are required for this flow:

  • 1) api_key
  • 2) api_secret
  • 3) refresh_token

The only formData paramter used for this flow is the refresh_token parameter. Since 1.0.4 (Release 5.13)

parameters.name: app_key
parameters.description: Convenience to pre-populate the Authorization header only

parameters.name: app_secret
parameters.description: Convenience to pre-populate the Authorization header only

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Phone number linked to account or extension in account in E.164 format with or without leading "+" sign

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: User's password

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: Optional. Extension short number. If company number is specified as a username, and "extension" is not specified, the server will attempt to authenticate client as main company administrator

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: Must hold "password" value for Resource Owner Credentials flow

parameters.name: access_token_ttl
parameters.description: Optional. Access token lifetime in seconds; the possible values are from 600 sec (10 min) to 3600 sec (1 hour). The default value is 3600 sec. If the value specified exceeds the default one, the default value is set. If the value specified is less than 600 seconds, the minimum value (600 sec) is set

parameters.name: refresh_token_ttl
parameters.description: Optional. Refresh token lifetime in seconds; default is 604800 sec (1 week). If the value specified exceeds the default one, the default value is set

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: List of API permissions to be used with access token. Can be omitted when requesting all permissions defined during the application registration phase

parameters.name: refresh_token
parameters.description: Previously issued refresh token. This is the only formData field used for the Refresh Token Flow. It is not used for the Resource Owner Password Credentials Flow

400.description:
• 1) invalid_request: Unsupported grant type
  • 2) invalid_client: Bad Application Release Status: Blocked

post.description: Revokes access/refresh token. Requests to this endpoint must be authenticated with HTTP Basic scheme using the application key and application secret as login and password, correspondingly. Since 1.0.5 (Release 5.14)

parameters.name: app_key
parameters.description: Used to populate the Authorization header

parameters.name: app_secret
parameters.description: Used to populate the Authorization header

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Active access or refresh token to be revoked

get.summary: Get Call Log Records by Filter
get.description: Every inbound and outbound call connected through the RingCentral service is logged in the database. Every extension on RingCentral account has an assigned Call Log that stores all inbound and outbound calls for the extension. Users are able to access all of their calls to get reliable information on callers' names, phone numbers, etc.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account which was logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: extensionNumber
parameters.description: Extension number of a user. If specified, returns call log for a particular extension only. Cannot be specified together with the phoneNumber filter

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: Phone number of a caller/call recipient. If specified, returns all calls (both incoming and outcoming) with the mentioned phone number. Cannot be specified together with the extensionNumber filter

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction for the result records. It is allowed to specify more than one direction. If not specified, both inbound and outbound records are returned. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Call type of a record. It is allowed to specify more than one type. If not specified, all call types are returned. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: Specifies the ending timestamp for result records. Default: current time

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: The start timestamp for result records. Default value is equal to dateTo minus 1 week

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Standard paging parameters

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Standard paging parameters

get.description: Returns individual message record by the given messageId.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the account which was logged-in within the current session. No batch support.

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session. No batch support.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a message. Batch support via comma delimited list

delete.description: Deletes an individual message or several messages by the given message IDs.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the account which was logged-in within the current session. No batch support.

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session. No batch support.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a message. Batch support via comma delimited list

put.description:
Updates an individual message or several messages. Currently, updating only the message read status is supported.
Note: If the status of the updating message is 'Purged', then 404 Not Found error code is returned. In case of incorrect request 400 Bad Request error code is returned. Since 1.0.2.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the account which was logged-in within the current session. No batch support.

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session. No batch support.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a message. Batch support via comma delimited list

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Read status of a message to be changed ['Read' | 'Unread']. Multiple values are accepted in a comma-delimited list corresponding to messageIds

delete.description: Deletes the entire message thread by the conversationId assigned to this message thread. It is possible to delete only one thread by one request, batch request is not supported. Since 1.0.2.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the account which was logged-in within the current session. No batch support.

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session. No batch support.

parameters.name: conversationId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a message.

get.description: Returns the list of messages from an extension mailbox. Since 1.0.2.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account which was logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: The phone number. If specified, messages are returned for this particular phone number only

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction for the resulting messages. If not specified, both inbound and outbound messages are returned. Multiple values are accepted.

parameters.name: messageType
parameters.description: The type of the resulting messages. If not specified, all messages without message type filtering are returned. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: readStatus
parameters.description: The read status for the resulting messages. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: Specifies the ending timestamp for the resulting messages. Default: current time

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: The start timestamp for the resulting messages. Default value is equal to dateFrom minus 1 week

parameters.name: conversationId
parameters.description: Specifies the conversation identifier for the resulting messages

parameters.name: availability
parameters.description: Specifies the availability status for the resulting messages. Default value is 'Alive'. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Standard paging parameters, see the section called “Common Query Parameters in Collection Resources”

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Standard paging parameters, see the section called “Common Query Parameters in Collection Resources”

post.description: Creates and sends new fax message. Since 1.0.2

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the account which was logged-in within the current session.

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: This form fills out this required field automatically using the example MIME boundary string.

parameters.name: Content-Length
parameters.description: Actual content length. This form fills out this required field automatically.

parameters.name: body
parameters.default:
--Boundary_1_14413901_1361871080888
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "to":[{"phoneNumber":"18005630003"}],
  "faxResolution":"High",
  "sendTime":"2013-02-26T09:31:20.882Z"
}

--Boundary_1_14413901_1361871080888
Content-Type: text/plain

Hello, World!

--Boundary_1_14413901_1361871080888--
parameters.description:
Multi-part MIME consisting of one part JSON body and one part text. For the MIME boundary, in this UI, use "Boundary_1_14413901_1361871080888". JSON body values:

PropertyData typeDescription
toContact Info objectRecipient information. phoneNumber property is mandatory
resolutionFax resolution
sendTimedatetimeOptional. Timestamp to send fax at. If not specified (current or the past), the fax is sent immediately
coverIndexInteger (0-13)
Optional. Cover page index. If not specified, the default cover page which is configured in "Outbound Fax Settings" is attached. See also "Available Cover Pages" table below
coverPageTextstringOptional. Cover page text, entered by the fax sender and printed on the cover page. Maximum length is limited to 1024 symbols

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account which was logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON body where from is a Caller Info object with at least phoneNumber populated and to is an array of Caller Info objects with at least phoneNumber populated. SMS is a text limited to 160 characters.

400.description:
• 1) Invalid Parameter: Cannot find the phone number which belongs to user;
  • 2) MSG-225: InvalidContent - Message length is greater than 160 symbols

post.description: Creates and sends new pager message. Since 1.0.2

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the account which was logged-in within the current session.

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension (integer) or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Multi-part MIME consiting of one part JSON body and one part text. JSON body values:

PropertyData typeDescription
to[Contact Info object]Receiver of pager message. The extensionNumber property must be filled
fromContact Info objectSender of pager message. The extensionNumber property must be filled
textstringText of pager message
replyOnintegerOptional. ID of a message this message replies to

400.description:
• 1) Bad Request: InvalidContent: The content is invalid. For example, the pager message exceeds the length limit (160 symbols)
  • 2) Bad Request: InvalidParameter: Bad Request One or many request parameters are invalid, refer to parameterName field in response
  • 3) Bad Request: RejectedByRecipient: Bad Request This extension/account does not support pager messages, or it is Disabled.

403.description:
• 1) Forbidden: FeatureNotAvailable: This extension/account does not support pager messages
  • 2) Forbidden: OldThreadReply: Reply is forbidden for old message threads
  • 3) Forbidden: OutOfThreadReply: Reply is denied for user, who is no longer a thread participant

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account which was logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: extensionId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of an extension or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON body where from and to are a Caller Info object with phoneNumber populated - phone number of the caller and called party correspondingly (mandatory), callerId is a Caller Info object with phoneNumber populated - the number which will be displayed to the called party (optional) and playPrompt is a boolean value - turn on/off the audio prompt that the calling party hears when the call is connected (optional).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON body with contact informaion where firstName, lastName, middleName, nickName are strings - representing contact name; company, jobTitle are strings - contact job; homePhone, homePhone2, businessPhone, businessPhone2, mobilePhone, businessFax, companyPhone, assistantPhone, carPhone, otherPhone, otherFax, callbackPhone are strings - contact phone numbers; email, email2, email3 are strings - contact email addresses; homeAddress, , are Contact Address Info objects - contact post addresses; birthday is a string - contact's date of birth; webPage is a string - contact's web page URL; notes is a string - extra notes for contact

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account which was logged-in within the current session

get.description:
Returns all available timezones.

This API provides access to all the available time zones and their respective IDs. They may be used to configure the default time zone and time zones for specific extensions. The API supports only one operation - retrieving available time zones.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Standard paging parameters

parameters.name: perPage

get.description: Returns the information about supported languages. Since 1.0.14 (Release 6.6)
Returns language by its respective ID. Since 1.0.14 (Release 6.6)

parameters.name: languageId
parameters.description: Internal identifier of a language; see the section called “Resource Identification Properties”

versionString.description: Version of the RingCentral REST API

uriString.description: URI part determining the current version

id.description: Internal unique identifier of a resource. This property exists in all resources which support retrieval/update/delete of a single record of particular type. Depending on a resource it can hold either an integer or a string value. The resource id is also passed as a path parameter in the URI

uri.description: Canonical URI of a resource. This URI might not be the same as the one which was used to retrieve this resource information. For example, if a resource was accessed by the URI containing simplified syntax with the tilde (~) characters, the canonical URI will also contain real identifiers. In most cases the URI contains an id value embedded as a path parameter

serviceInfo.description: Account service information, including brand, service plan and billing plan

mainNumber.description: Main phone number of the current account

setupWizardState.description: Specifies account configuration wizard state (web service setup). The default value is 'NotStarted'

statusInfo.description: Collection of parameters. Status information (reason, comment, lifetime). Returned for 'Disabled' status only

comment.description: A free-form user comment, describing the status change reason

till.description: Date until which the account will get deleted. The default value is 30 days since current time

partnerId.description: Additional account identifier, developed and applied by the client

For Partner Applications Internal identifier of an extension created by partner. The RingCentral supports the mapping of accounts and stores the corresponding accountId/extensionId for each partnerId of a client application. In request URIs partnerIds are accepted instead of regular RingCentral native IDs as path parameters using pid = XXX clause. Though in response URIs contain the corresponding accountIds and extensionIds. In all request and response bodies these values are reflected via "partnerId" attributes of account and extension

departments.description: Information on department extension(s), to which the requested extension belongs. Returned only for user extensions, members of department, requested by single extensionId [JCW type Collection of Parameters]

statusInfo.description: Collection of parameters  Status information (reason, comment). Returned for 'Disabled' status only [JCW Collection of Parameters]

comment.description: A free-form user comment, describing the status change reason

serviceFeatures.description: JCW Collection of [Extension Service Feature Info]  Extension service features returned in response only when the logged-in user requests his/her own extension info, see also Extension Service Features

regionalSettings.description: Extension region data (timezone, home country, language)

setupWizardState.description: Specifies extension configuration wizard state (web service setup). The default value is 'NotStarted'

permissions.description: Extension permissions, corresponding to the Service Web permissions "Admin" and "InternationalCalling"

greetingLanguage.description: Information on language used for telephony greetings

formattingLocale.descripion: Formatting language preferences for numbers, dates and currencies

id.description: Internal identifier of a language, greeting language, or formatting language
Standard resource properties ID and canonical URI

uri.description: Standard resource properties ID and canonical URI

partnerId.description: For Partner Applications Internal identifier of an extension created by partner. The RingCentral supports the mapping of accounts and stores the corresponding accountId/extensionId for each partnerId of a client application. In request URIs partnerIds are accepted instead of regular RingCentral native IDs as path parameters using pid = XXX clause. Though in response URIs contain the corresponding accountIds and extensionIds. In all request and response bodies these values are reflected via "partnerId" attributes of account and extension

ServiceInfo.description: Account service information, including brand, service plan and billing plan

id.description: Internal identifier of a home country
Internal identifier of a service plan
Internal identifier of a billing plan
